article.para: Thank you for your interest in Ubuntu &distro-rev; - the &distro-version; - released in &distro-release-date;.

Ubuntu is an entirely open source operating system built around the Linux kernel. The Ubuntu community is built around the ideals enshrined in the Ubuntu Philosophy: that software should be available free of charge, that software tools should be usable by people in their local language and despite any disabilities, and that people should have the freedom to customize and alter their software in whatever way they see fit. For those reasons:
Ubuntu will aye be free o chairge, an there isna ony extrae fee for the "enterprise edition," we mak oor gey best wark available tae onybody on the same Free terms.
Ubuntu includes the gey best in translations an accessibility infrastructure that the free saftware commonty has tae offer, tae mak Ubuntu uissable for as mony fowk as possible.
Ubuntu is lowsit raiglarly an forespokably; a spleet-new release is makkit ilka sax month. Ye can uiss the current siccar release or the current development release. Ilk release is uphauden for at laist 18 month.
Ubuntu is haily commttit tae the principles o open source saftware development; we forder fowk tae uiss open source saftware, tae haud forrit it an pass it on.
Find out more at the Ubuntu website.

sect1.title: Aboot the Name
sect1.para: Ubuntu is a Sooth African ethical ideologu focusing on fowk's allegiances an kin wi ane an ither. The wird comes frae the Zulu an Xhosa leids. Ubuntu (pronooncit "oo-BOON-too") is seen as a tradeetional African concept, is regairdit as ane o the fandin principles o the new republic o Sooth Africa an is connectit tae the idea o an African Renaissance.
A coorse translation o the principle o Ubuntu is "we're aw Jock Tamson's bairns". Anither translation coud be: "the trowe in warldwide wap o sharin that connects aw humanity".

blockquote.para: Somebody wi ubuntu is open an available tae ithers, affirmin o others, disna feel thraitenit that ithers are able an guid, for he or she haes a richt self-assurance that comes frae kennin that he or she belangs in a gey muckle hale an is dimeenishit whan ithers are humiliatit or dimeenishit, whan ithers are torturit or oult."

sect1.para: As a platform based on Linux, the Ubuntu operating system brings the spirit of ubuntu to the software world.

sect1.title: Free Saftware
sect1.para: The Ubuntu project is haily committit tae the principles o open source saftware development; fowk are encouraged tae uiss open source saftware, haud forrit it, an pass it on. This means that Ubuntu is an will aye be free o chairge.

Houaniver, this means mair than jist bein available at nae cost. The philosophy o free saftware is that fowk shoud be free tae uiss saftware in aw the weys that are "socially uissfu". "Free saftware" disna jist mean that ye shouldna hae tae pey for it, it means that ye shoud be able tae uiss the saftware in ony wey ye want an aw: the code that maks up free saftware is available for onybody tae download, cheenge, mend, an uiss in ony wey. So apairt frae the fact that free saftware is aften available athoor chairge, this freedom haes technical advantages an aw: whan programmes are developit, the haurd wark o ithers can be uised an biggit upon. Wi non-free saftware, this canna happen an whan programs are developit, they hae tae stert frae scratch. For this reason the development o free saftware is fast, feckfu an excitin!
You can find out more about the philosophy of free software here.

sect1.title: The Differ
sect1.para: There are many different operating systems based on Linux: Debian, SuSE, Gentoo, RedHat, and Mandriva are examples. Ubuntu is yet another contender in what is already a highly competitive world. So what makes Ubuntu different?

Foondit on Debian, ane o the maist widely acclaimit, technologically advanced, an weel-supportit distreebutions, Ubuntu aims tae shape a distreebution that provides a modren an coherent Linux seestem for dasktap an server computin. ubuntu includes a nummer o carefully selectit packages frae the Debian distreebution an retains its powerfu package management seestem whit allous eith installation an clean removal o programmes. No like mais distreebutions that are lowsit wi a heap o saftware that micht or micht no be o uiss, Ubuntu's list o packages is reducit tae a nummer o important applications o heich staundart.

By focussin on quality, Ubuntu produces a stench an featurfu computin environs that is fittin for uiss in baith hame an office environs. The project taks the time requirit tae focus on sma'er details an is able tae lowse a version featurin the mais recent an best o today's saftware ance ilka 6 month. Ubuntu is available in flavours for the i386 (386/486/Pentium(II/III/IV) an Athlon/Duron/Sempron processors), AMD64 (Athlon64, Opteron, an new 64-bit Intel processors), an PowerPC (iBook/Powerbook, G4 and G5) architectures.

sect1.title: The Dasktap
sect1.para: The default desktop environment for Ubuntu is GNOME, a leading UNIX and Linux desktop suite and development platform.

Another leading UNIX and Linux desktop is KDE. The Kubuntu project offers Ubuntu users an alternative choice to the default GNOME desktop environment. Thanks to the efforts of the Kubuntu team, Ubuntu users are now able to install and use the KDE desktop easily on their system. To get a working install of Kubuntu on an Ubuntu install, install the kubuntu-desktop package. Once kubuntu-desktop is installed, one can choose to use either a Gnome or KDE desktop environment.

sect1.title: Version an Lowse Nummers
sect1.para: The Ubuntu version numbering scheme is based on the date we release a version of the distribution. The version number comes from the year and month of the release rather than reflecting the actual version of the software. Our first release (Warty Warthog) was in October 2004 so its version was 4.10. This version (&distro-version;) was released in &distro-release-date; so its version number is &distro-rev;.

sect1.title: Backin an Upkeep
sect1.para: Ubuntu is maintained by a quickly growing community. The project is sponsored by Canonical Ltd., a holding company founded by Mark Shuttleworth. Canonical employs the core Ubuntu developers and offers support and consulting services for Ubuntu.
Canonical Ltd also sponsors a number of other Open Source software projects, about which more information can be found on the Canonical website.

sect1.title: Whit is Linux?
sect1.para: The Linux kernel, pronounced 'lee-nucks' is the heart of the Ubuntu operating system. A kernel is an important part of any operating system, providing the communication bridge between hardware and software.

Linux wis born in 1991 by a Finnish scholart cried Linux Torvalds. At the time, it woud run only on i386 seestems, an wis essentially an independently shapit clone o the UNIX kernel, intendit tae tak advantage o the then new i386 architecture.
Thir days, thanks tae a muckle amoont o development effort by fowk aw aroond the warld, Linux runs on awmaist ilka modren architecture.

The Linux kernel haes win an ideological importance on top o a technical ane. Thare is a hail commonty o fowk wha trowe in the ideals o free saftware an spend thair time helpin tae mak open source technology as guid as it can be.

Fowk in this commonty gie rise tae initiatives sic as Ubuntu, staundarts comatees that shape the development o the Interwab, organisations like the Mozilla Foondation, responsible for shapin Mozilla Firefox, an coontless ither saftware projects frae whit ye've certaintly gainit frae in the past.
The speerit o open source, for common attributit tae Linux, is influencin saftware developers an uisers awwhaur tae drive commonties wi common goals.

sect1.title: Whit is GNU?
sect1.para: The GNU Project, pronounced “guh-noo”, was launched in 1984 to develop a complete UNIX style operating system which is comprised of free software: the GNU system. Variants of the GNU operating system, which use the Linux kernel, are now widely used.
The GNU project is closely relatit tae the philosophy o free saftware, that is at the hert o tae the projects that come frae it, sic as Ubuntu. The concept o free saftware is exponit at .
